alert.note: Alert for Saint Croix (Virgin Islands) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 26 at 3:28PM AST until October 26 at 6:45PM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Juan has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Saint Croix County in Virgin Islands... * Until 645 PM AST. * At 328 PM AST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms and bands of heavy rains continued to stream northwards across the warned area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding and excessive runoff caused by thunderstorms and shower activity. SOURCE...Radar and surface observations reports. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Mudslides and rockfall in areas of steep terrain. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Grove Place, Frederiksted South, Christiansted and Frederiksted. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
